bibl.title: English translation [from French] of letter from R. Antonetti to the Director of the Rockefeller Foundation, November 30, 1922

div1.p: Antonetti expresses his thanks for the Foundation's help regarding the recent outbreaks of yellow fever in French West Africa.

div1.head: English translation [from French] of letter from R. Antonetti to the Director of the Rockefeller Foundation, November 30, 1922
div1.opener:
I. H. B.
Africa.
Carter
Carter
Translation
Gouvernement General
de
l'Afrique Occidentale Francaise
Republique Francaise
Bingerville, 30th November 1922.
The Lieutenant-Governor of the Ivory Coast
To: Director of the Rockefeller Foundation
rue de Berri, Paris.
Dear Professor:
div1.p:
The parcel sent me that 1st September 1922, for the Health Service,
reached me very rapidly.

An epidemic of yellow fever, of very brief duration, broke out at
Bassam, principal port of my Colony, from the 17th August to the 22nd August.
Use was made of the antiicteroide vaccin that you kindly sent the previous
year to Dr. Bauvallet as an emergency provision.

It is for me a very agreeable duty to send you in the name of the
Colony my thanks for the promptitude with which you placed yourselves at our
disposition and for the rapidity with which we received, in the best condi-
tion, the serum and vaccine sent from the Rockefeller Institute and manufactured
by Dr. Noguchi.

I am sending you the first report made by the Health Service of the
facts ascertained during this brief epidemic, which might have been very serious.
Dr. Bauvallet, on duty on Bassam at the time of the outbreak, will send direct
to Dr. Noguchi with whom he has been in direct personal relations since 1921,
a detailed and precise report of observations made by him and the results ob-
tained with the serum which you had sent to me.

With renowed thanks which I will ask you to transmit to the
Committee Director of the Rockefeller Foundation, please accept the assurance of high esteem.
